Explanations: Bee-friendly: This plant has a good nectar or pollen supply, which is especially good for honey and wild bees, as well as other pollinating insects. There are 500 different kinds of wild bees alone. Some crops are best approached by specialists, others by generalists.
Name: BUTTERFLY
Description:
wb16
This mixture contains more than 20 different species, including meadow bellflower, knapweed, scabious, horn clover and spring primrose and is particularly good for butterflies. Should be cut once or twice a year (summer/autumn).
Positive for pollinators: Yes

Name: SHADE
Description:
wb11
This mixture for predominantly shady locations consists of over 15 different wildflowers, including wood carnation, betony, Jacobâ€™s ladder and ground ivy. The composition promotes and maintains plant diversity in damp and shady locations.

Explanations: Bee-friendly: This plant has a good nectar or pollen supply, which is especially good for honey and wild bees, as well as other pollinating insects. There are 500 different kinds of wild bees alone. Some crops are best approached by specialists, others by generalists.
Name: WILD
Description:
FIELD HERBS
 wb12
Field herbs provide habitats that are needed by many beneficial insects. This mixture consists of over 15 different field herbs, including cornflower, real caraway, real chamomile, field black cumin and wild mallow.
Positive for pollinators: Yes

Explanations: Bee-friendly: This plant has a good nectar or pollen supply, which is especially good for honey and wild bees, as well as other pollinating insects. There are 500 different kinds of wild bees alone. Some crops are best approached by specialists, others by generalists.
Name: WILD
Description:
HERBAGE FOR DRY MEADOWS
 wb21
Mixture of over 25 species of wildflowers, including daisies, sainfoin, oregano, Carthusian pinks, hawkweed-like bittercress. For very barren soils and areas of gravel. Depending on the location, it may not require cutting at all or twice a year at the most.
Positive for pollinators: Yes

Explanations: Bee-friendly: This plant has a good nectar or pollen supply, which is especially good for honey and wild bees, as well as other pollinating insects. There are 500 different kinds of wild bees alone. Some crops are best approached by specialists, others by generalists.
Name: WILD
Description:
HERBAGE FOR LAWNS
 wb20
Mixture of over 20 species of wildflowers, including knapweed, ribwort, horn clover, daisy and yarrow. Particularly suitable for sowing into existing nutrient-poor grassland. Before sowing, scarify the lawn well and then sow the seeds in the bald areas.
Positive for pollinators: Yes
